'Grass Valley' is a privately held company based in San Francisco, and
originally founded in Grass Valley, California. It develops and produces
technology and services for the video and broadcast industry, with a
broad offering of "glass to glass" solutions for live video production,
news and playout.

Grass Valley's video files architecture is called Stratus, an opened SOA
software suite that manages video contents from glass (camera) to glass
(television or IP connected device). It operates with direct sales and services
operations around the world, and spends more than 15% of its revenue in R&D
(half of its employers are development and service engineers).
